description: loads the commands in the class <arg>.
The classes and their corresponding commands can be determined using the ".help" command.
unloads the commands in the class <arg>.
The classes and their corresponding commands can be determined using the ".help" command.
reloads the commands in the class <arg>.
The classes and their corresponding commands can be determined using the ".help" command.
creates a graph to show some statistics regarding the command usage.
the different way to count up the command usage are: "command", "year", "month", "day"
"hour", "channel_aliases", "invoked_with", "invoked_subcommand"
You may optionally choose to group the entries such that all the times that a certain command was executed on a certain day are counted together
You can do this with the command ".frequency command day"
executes the command <arg> on the bot server.
The classes and their corresponding commands can be determined using the ".help" command.
returns pong!
returns <arg>
Displays all users with permissions to view the current channel.

Results can be filter by looking for users whose useraliases or nickaliases on the server contains the substring indicated with any of the included strings or all users if no args are given. Multiple may be entered.
returns which branch the user is testing
returns <args> but in emoji format
an interface to the reference manuals
help can be used with no argument in order to list each command and provide a brief overview of each command
In order to bring up specific examples of how to use each command, use ".man <command>"
Commands to create a  poll in a channel.
Doing `.poll <arg>` starts a yes/no poll where <arg> is the question
A poll can also be created with multiple options. When choosing multiple options, you can specify up to 12 arguments
returns definition from urban dictionary of <arg>
returns the result of passing <arg> to Wolfram Alpha
Allows Minions to post embed messages.
For odd number of arguments the first arg will be used as description in the embed and the rest as field title and content.
For even number there will be no description.
Posts the warning message <arg> in embed format. No quotes required with message.

example:
Please call command like so:

remindmein <time format> to <what to remind you about>
remindmeon <time format> to <what to remind you about>
remindmeat <time format> to <what to remind you about>

Timezone assumed to be Canada/Pacific unless otherwise specified
A list of valid timezones can be found at
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones

Example Time Formats:
[n] [seconds|minutes|hours]
- Example: .remindmein 10 minutes to turn in my assignment

[n] [day(s) after [date|tomorrow|today]]
- Example: .remindmein two days after tomorrow to go to the bank

[time] [timezone]?
- Example: .remindmeat 1:15pm Canada/Eastern to video call

[date] [at]? [time] [timezone]?
- Example: .remindmeon October 5th at 12:30pm to eat lunch
description: create a reminder
Show all your active reminders and their corresponding messageIDs
deletes a reminder that has a messageId of <arg>
the "messageId" can be obtained by using the ".showreminders" command
creates roles <arg>
deletes roles <arg>
adds you to roles <arg>
removes you from roles <arg>
returns everyone who has roles <arg>
will display all the self-assignable roles that exist
will display all the Mod/Exec/XP Assigned roles that exist
deletes all empty self-assignable roles
Returns the calendar description from current semester of <arg>
Returns outline details of course `<arg0>`.
Defaults to current term and section d100.
Optionally, you may specify term in `<arg1>` and/or section with `<arg2>`.
Added keyword `next` will look at next semesters oultine for `<arg0>`;Note `next` will return error if it is not registration time.

example: `.team <team name> <game name> <comma seperated list of team members> [<hex code/value for embed colour>]`
description: Creates an embed that holds details about your Frosh game team.

Need help picking a colour?
[HTML Colour Codes](https://htmlcolorcodes.com/color-picker/)

example: `.reportwin <team name> <comma seperated list of team mmembers>`
description: Creates an embed that report a win for your team.
Command will read in all the guild bans into wall_e database to use custom ban system.
**Command you only be used ONCE.**
Bans the @ mentioned user(s) with the given reason. Default reason is "No Reason Given!"
Reason can be given with or without quotes.
Unbans a user with the provided user_id
Lists the `username` and `user_id` of all banned users from the guild.
Clears the ban list on the guild.
